spiritual-heart-india.title: Discover the Spiritual Heart of India – Varanasi & Ayodhya Tour
spiritual-heart-india.description: A sacred journey through the spiritual soul of India, covering Varanasi’s divine ghats and temples and Ayodhya’s Ramayana heritage.
spiritual-heart-india.longDescription: Uttar Pradesh, the heartland of India, is a treasure trove of spirituality, history, and culture. Home to some of the most sacred sites in Hinduism, it offers an enriching journey into the country’s divine heritage. In Prayagraj, the holy confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati at the Triveni Sangam draws pilgrims and seekers from across the globe, while the grandeur of the Kumbh Mela showcases the city’s spiritual vibrance. Ayodhya, revered as the birthplace of Lord Rama, is steeped in devotion and mythology, with its ancient temples and the majestic Ram Janmabhoomi. Varanasi, the oldest living city in the world, enchants visitors with its sacred ghats, the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti, and the timeless aura of Kashi Vishwanath Temple, offering a spiritual experience like no other. Together, these destinations make Uttar Pradesh a must-visit for those seeking a deeper connection with India’s spiritual and cultural soul.
includes: All transfers and sightseeing by Personalized AC Car
All Toll tax, parking fees & driver allowances
excludes: Entrance fees to monuments and museum
Other meals not mentioned laundry, telephone calls, and incidentals.
Any personal expenses. Room service and special orders. Alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages.
Any expense arising due to unforeseen circumstances is not included.

itineraryDays.title: Arrival in Varanasi – Local Sightseeing
activities: Arrival and check-in at hotel
Visit Kashi Vishwanath Temple and Annapurna Devi Temple
Explore Tulsi Manas Mandir and BHU's New Vishwanath Temple
Attend Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat
Dinner recommendation: Banarasi thali with kachori-sabzi and malaiyo
Overnight stay in Varanasi

itineraryDays.title: Varanasi – Sarnath Excursion and Food Exploration
activities: Sunrise boat ride on the Ganges
Visit Sarnath: Dhamek Stupa, Mulagandhakuti Vihara, and Archaeological Museum
Return to Varanasi for shopping and leisure
Food: chhole bhature, lassi, jalebi, Banarasi paan, chaat
Overnight stay in Varanasi

itineraryDays.title: Varanasi to Ayodhya – Exploring the Ramayana Trails
activities: Drive to Ayodhya (Approx. 4 hrs)
Visit Ram Janmabhoomi Temple, Hanuman Garhi, Kanak Bhawan, and Guptar Ghat
Evening by the Sarayu River
Food: Vegetarian thali, peda, motichoor laddoo
Overnight stay in Ayodhya

itineraryDays.title: Ayodhya to Varanasi – Departure
activities: Drive back to Varanasi (Approx. 4 hrs)
En route snacks: masala chai, kachoris
Drop-off at Varanasi Airport or Railway Station

galleryImages.alt: Varanasi and Ayodhya Spiritual Tour Image

sacred-circuit.title: The Sacred Circuit – Varanasi & Prayagraj Tour
sacred-circuit.description: A spiritual journey across Uttar Pradesh’s holiest destinations – experience the Ganga Aarti, Sarnath’s Buddhist legacy, and the divine confluence at Prayagraj.
sacred-circuit.longDescription: Uttar Pradesh, the heartland of India, is a treasure trove of spirituality, history, and culture. Home to some of the most sacred sites in Hinduism, it offers an enriching journey into the country’s divine heritage. In Prayagraj, the holy confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati at the Triveni Sangam draws pilgrims and seekers from across the globe, while the grandeur of the Kumbh Mela showcases the city’s spiritual vibrance. Ayodhya, revered as the birthplace of Lord Rama, is steeped in devotion and mythology, with its ancient temples and the majestic Ram Janmabhoomi. Varanasi, the oldest living city in the world, enchants visitors with its sacred ghats, the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti, and the timeless aura of Kashi Vishwanath Temple, offering a spiritual experience like no other. Together, these destinations make Uttar Pradesh a must-visit for those seeking a deeper connection with India’s spiritual and cultural soul.

All Toll tax, parking fees & driver allowances
excludes: Entrance fees to monuments and museum

itineraryDays.title: Arrival in Varanasi – Evening Ganga Aarti
activities: Arrival and hotel check-in
Evening Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat
Optional boat ride on the Ganges
Dinner: Banarasi Kachori-Sabzi, Tamatar Chaat
Overnight stay in Varanasi

itineraryDays.title: Varanasi – Spiritual and Cultural Exploration
activities: Sunrise boat ride on the Ganges
Visit Kashi Vishwanath Temple and surrounding shrines
Excursion to Sarnath: Dhamek Stupa, Chaukhandi Stupa, Archaeological Museum
Evening market walk for Banarasi sarees and local crafts
Food: Malaiyo or Banarasi Thali
Overnight stay in Varanasi

itineraryDays.title: Varanasi to Prayagraj – The Land of Sangam
activities: Drive to Prayagraj (~120 km | 3 hrs)
Take a dip at Triveni Sangam
Visit Anand Bhavan, Swaraj Bhavan, and exterior of Allahabad Fort
Evening at riverbanks or Prayagraj markets
Food: Famous guavas and Churmura
Overnight stay in Prayagraj

itineraryDays.title: Departure from Prayagraj
activities: Visit Khusro Bagh and Hanuman Mandir (reclining Hanuman idol)
Transfer to Prayagraj Airport or Railway Station

galleryImages.alt: Varanasi and Prayagraj Sacred Tour Image

spiritual-symphony.title: Spiritual Symphony by the Sacred River – Varanasi Tour
spiritual-symphony.description: Immerse in the spiritual rhythm of Varanasi through sacred rituals, serene boat rides, ancient temples, and Buddhist heritage at Sarnath.
spiritual-symphony.longDescription: Uttar Pradesh, the heartland of India, is a treasure trove of spirituality, history, and culture. Home to some of the most sacred sites in Hinduism, it offers an enriching journey into the country’s divine heritage. In Prayagraj, the holy confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati at the Triveni Sangam draws pilgrims and seekers from across the globe, while the grandeur of the Kumbh Mela showcases the city’s spiritual vibrance. Ayodhya, revered as the birthplace of Lord Rama, is steeped in devotion and mythology, with its ancient temples and the majestic Ram Janmabhoomi. Varanasi, the oldest living city in the world, enchants visitors with its sacred ghats, the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti, and the timeless aura of Kashi Vishwanath Temple, offering a spiritual experience like no other. Together, these destinations make Uttar Pradesh a must-visit for those seeking a deeper connection with India’s spiritual and cultural soul.

itineraryDays.title: Arrival in Varanasi – Evening Ganga Aarti
activities: Arrival and transfer to hotel
Stroll through Varanasi’s local streets
Attend Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat
Optional evening boat ride
Try Kachori-Sabzi and Banarasi Tamatar Chaat
Overnight stay in Varanasi

itineraryDays.title: Spiritual and Cultural Exploration
activities: Sunrise boat ride on the Ganges
Visit Kashi Vishwanath Temple
Explore Sarnath: Dhamek Stupa, Chaukhandi Stupa, Archaeological Museum
Shop at Varanasi’s bazaars for silk sarees and handicrafts
Try Banarasi Paan, Malaiyo (seasonal), and a traditional Thali
Overnight stay in Varanasi

itineraryDays.title: Departure from Varanasi
activities: Visit Assi Ghat and Bharat Mata Temple
Transfer to Varanasi Airport or Railway Station

golden-triangle-faith.title: Golden Triangle of Faith – Varanasi, Ayodhya & Prayagraj Tour
golden-triangle-faith.location: Varanasi, Ayodhya, Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, India
golden-triangle-faith.description: Embark on a spiritually enriching journey through Varanasi’s sacred ghats, Ayodhya’s Ramayana heritage, and Prayagraj’s divine Triveni Sangam.
golden-triangle-faith.longDescription: Uttar Pradesh, the heartland of India, is a treasure trove of spirituality, history, and culture. Home to some of the most sacred sites in Hinduism, it offers an enriching journey into the country’s divine heritage. In Prayagraj, the holy confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati at the Triveni Sangam draws pilgrims and seekers from across the globe, while the grandeur of the Kumbh Mela showcases the city’s spiritual vibrance. Ayodhya, revered as the birthplace of Lord Rama, is steeped in devotion and mythology, with its ancient temples and the majestic Ram Janmabhoomi. Varanasi, the oldest living city in the world, enchants visitors with its sacred ghats, the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti, and the timeless aura of Kashi Vishwanath Temple, offering a spiritual experience like no other. Together, these destinations make Uttar Pradesh a must-visit for those seeking a deeper connection with India’s spiritual and cultural soul.

itineraryDays.title: Arrival in Varanasi – Local Sightseeing
activities: Arrival and hotel check-in
Visit Kashi Vishwanath Temple, Annapurna Devi Temple, and Tulsi Manas Mandir
Tour Banaras Hindu University (BHU) and New Vishwanath Temple
Evening Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat
Dinner: Banarasi thali with kachori-sabzi and malaiyo
Overnight stay in Varanasi

itineraryDays.title: Varanasi – Sarnath Excursion and Food Exploration
activities: Sunrise boat ride on the Ganges
Visit Sarnath: Dhamek Stupa, Mulagandhakuti Vihara, and Archaeological Museum
Return for shopping at local markets (Banarasi sarees, brassware)
Food: chhole bhature, lassi, jalebi, paan, and chaat
Overnight stay in Varanasi

itineraryDays.title: Varanasi to Ayodhya – Ramayana Trails
activities: Drive to Ayodhya (Approx. 4 hrs)
Visit Ram Janmabhoomi Temple, Hanuman Garhi, and Kanak Bhawan
Spend a peaceful evening by the Sarayu River
Food: Vegetarian thali, peda, motichoor laddoo
Overnight stay in Ayodhya

itineraryDays.title: Ayodhya to Prayagraj – Exploring the Sangam City
activities: Drive to Prayagraj (Approx. 4 hrs)
Visit Triveni Sangam (optional boat ride), Anand Bhawan, and Allahabad Fort
Visit Hanuman Mandir with reclining Hanuman idol
Food: Prayagraj’s kebabs, kulfi falooda, imarti
Overnight stay in Prayagraj

itineraryDays.title: Prayagraj to Varanasi – Departure
activities: Drive back to Varanasi (Approx. 3.5 hrs)
En route refreshments
Drop-off at Varanasi Airport or Railway Station
